Management TEAM Thank you for your interest in Streamsong, the premier golf resort in Central Florida . We are pleased to provide you with the assistance and information you require. Should you wish to speak with someone directly in regards to Streamsong golf, accommodations, and other resort facilities , our contact directory can help you find the answers to your questions.

ABOUT STREAMSONG Seas of Change Many millions of years ago, land that is now Streamsong Resort was covered by oceans and exposed land, home to both giant earth and sea creatures. Thick forests and grassy plains provided refuge for shovel-tusked mastodons, hornless rhinos, humpless camels and 30-foot crocodiles. Warm waters surrounding the area were filled with a rich variety of prehistoric marine life, including the notorious and now extinct giant shark, Megalodon like the one displayed in the Resort‚Äôs Lobby. Glacial activity caused the oceans to rise and fall again and again over a 50 million year period. At times, Florida was twice its current width. At other times it was less than 100 miles long and 10 miles wide. Man‚Äôs activities here trace to early Indian tribes living in native villages throughout the region. Hernando DeSoto and his army camped on this property in 1539. Early settlers endured incredible hardships to tame Central Florida‚Äôs vast, wild lands for ranching and farming. Their story is chronicled in the award-winning novel, A Land Remembered, which is found in every guest room of Streamsong Lodge . It‚Äôs in our Bones In the late 1800s came the discovery of massive phosphate rock deposits that had formed 10 to 15 million years earlier when the oceans receded and the remains of sea life settled into the deep sediment layers that were left behind. An industry was thus born that would become the economic backbone of Central Florida for more than a century. Fossils discovered in the phosphate mines of Florida have revealed much about the history of the land. They tell us that many species of mammals came to tropical and sub-tropical Florida forests from other parts of the world to escape the advancing glaciers of the great ‚ÄúIce Ages.‚Äù Thanks to the unique geological characteristics of this phosphate-rich region, most of the fossils are beautifully preserved, with amazing detail and color. To this day, the land surrounding Streamsong is known as the Bone Valley region of Florida. Streamsong Today The Mosaic Company, founders of Streamsong, sought ways to further enhance the land it reclaimed after mining and to support the communities where it operated.¬† In 2012 Mosaic embarked on an innovative development opportunity called Streamsong as a prototype for post‚Äêmining economic and environmental sustainability. Moving from one land use to another, Streamsong showcases how reclaimed land can be commercially developed in an environmentally responsible manner, while also becoming an economic driver for rural areas. Since opening experienced biologists, botanists, environmental engineers and committed hospitality professionals have done more than just reclaim this formally mined land; they have improved it. A bold vision that started just over a decade ago now helps support the local economy creating over 450 hospitality-related jobs, and protecting the land, water and wildlife ‚Äì all paramount to the resort‚Äôs ongoing operation, now owned and operated by KemperSports. Streamsong is a place where individuals and organizations can accomplish things of value and return renewed. The transformation of this unique landscape gave rise to a one-of-a-kind golf destination now known around the world as a place so aptly named ‚Äì Streamsong. No highways, no houses or condos, no obstructed sunrises or sunsets. Just the sights and sounds, the flora and fauna, the water and wind of natural Florida.
LOCATION Finding your way to Streamsong¬Æ is easier and closer than you think. Our luxury accommodations, three renowned golf courses‚ÄîStreamsong¬Æ Blue, Streamsong¬Æ Red, and Streamsong¬Æ Black are located within 90 minutes of both Tampa and Orlando and 30 minutes south of Lakeland in Central Florida. MEETINGS & EVENTS Accomplish the Incredible Streamsong is a meeting and incentive destination intentionally designed in harmony with its natural surroundings and deeply committed to the highest aspirations of today‚Äôs business elite. Here you will experience an environment uniquely designed to spark innovation, fuel motivation and engage communication in ways you‚Äôve never imagined. From an intimate executive retreat to a grand gathering, Streamsong is a place to accomplish things of value and return renewed. The resort offers an inspirational, distraction-free environment with 25,000 sq. ft. of dedicated meeting space and 60,000 sq. ft. of dramatic outdoor venues. 12 large and small meeting rooms accommodate 10 to 500 in complete comfort and privacy. General session and breakout rooms are conveniently clustered for effective program flow. Experienced conference coordinators and onsite media services ensure every detail of your program is handled promptly and professionally. We understand truly great meetings are the ones that ignite an audience with the power to inspire, entertain and educate. Streamsong provides a distraction-free environment enabling you to take your message far beyond the four walls of a meeting room. Believe it. The right meeting can change your company forever. We know, Streamsong is now the preferred destination for many of today‚Äôs biggest, brightest and fastest growing organizations. Let us help you accomplish the incredible. Submit an RFP for more information. SUBMIT RFP RESORT MAP EVENT FACILITIES MEETING PLANNER GUIDE STREAMSONG STORY VIDEO
VENUES ARCHITECTS HALL Over 7500 sq. ft. of space with option to break into three separate rooms Architects Hall is the largest indoor function space at Streamsong complete with private entrance. Streamsong Black Clubhouse A private dining room as well as the option to reserve the entire clubhouse and the gauntlet putting course for special events and groups. SMALL MEETINGS Coore, Crenshaw, Hanse and Wagner are perfect for small group and executive retreat meetings combining to create 884 and 1350 sq. ft. respectively. Just steps from the Lodge lobby this flexible space can be broken into four small rooms or combined to make two larger venues. BOARD ROOMS Bordeaux and Toscana are located on the lower level of the Lodge and provide the perfect board meeting venue. At 844 and 750 sq. ft. respectively both rooms are wired for sound with flatscreen TVs and the latest in audio visual options. FACILITIES OVERVIEW LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR FACILITIES SERVICES WEDDINGS LEARN MORE ABOUT WEDDINGS CONTACT SALES TEAM ANDREA SMITH Director of Group Sales 863.344.1471 Florida:¬† Northeast US: West Coast [email¬†protected] Andrea Smith, Director of Group Sales, joined the Streamsong Resort in December, 2014. Prior to Streamsong, Andrea was a Sales Leader at the Sawgrass Marriott Golf Resort & Spa for 18 years. As a team leader at Streamsong, Andrea is able to build unique group experiences in a one of a kind destination. EMAIL JESSICA CANNON Senior Sales Manager 813.955.6372 Florida:¬† South East US:¬† North East and South East [email¬†protected] Jessica Cannon joined the Streamsong Sales Team in 2018 after years of experience with Omni Hotels.¬† Jessica is based in GA. Although her career started in catering, she has been working with groups now for over 18 years. Jessica is responsible for corporate groups with a special focus on the Financial and Insurance markets. EMAIL MICHELLE LEWIS Senior Sales Manager 863.344.0627 Florida:¬† Central and West Coast US:¬† Mid West and Mid Atlantic [email¬†protected] Michelle joined Streamsong with over 15 years of sales experience. Michelle previously held the positions of National Sales Manager at Innisbrook Resort and InterContinental Tampa. She achieved numerous accolades including Chairmen‚Äôs Club, President‚Äôs Club, and Manager of the Year recognition. A graduate of Indiana University of Pennsylvania. EMAIL Christina Wiedersheim VIP Services & Events Manager 863.312.6007 [email¬†protected] Christina has over 25 years of experience in the hospitality industry, including sales, catering, and event management. She gained valuable experience with several Marriott and Ritz-Carlton Resorts in Florida, as well as the Waldorf Astoria Resort in Orlando. Christina joined the Streamsong team in 2012.
